name: Apple Inc.
description: Global technology giant, maker of iPhone, Mac, iPad, Apple Watch.

name: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.
description: Largest semiconductor foundry, exclusive chip fabricator for Apple.

name: Hon Hai Precision Industry
description: World’s largest electronics manufacturer, major assembler of iPhones.

name: Samsung Electronics
description: Major smartphone competitor and component supplier to Apple.

name: Alphabet Inc.
description: Creator of Android OS, Apple’s main smartphone platform rival and search partner.

name: Qualcomm
description: Supplier of cellular modem chips vital for iPhones’ connectivity.

name: Broadcom
description: Provider of wireless components (Wi-Fi/Bluetooth chips) for Apple devices.

name: Sony Corporation
description: Supplier of camera sensors for Apple iPhones.

name: LG Display
description: Supplier of display panels for Apple devices.

name: SK Hynix
description: Memory chip supplier to Apple.

name: Micron Technology
description: Supplier of memory components for Apple devices.

name: Pegatron
description: Apple contract manufacturer, assembles iPhones and iPads.

name: Wistron
description: Contract manufacturer assembling Apple devices.

name: Luxshare Precision
description: Contract electronics manufacturer, increasingly assembles Apple devices.

name: Epic Games
description: Gaming company, challenged Apple’s App Store policies in court.

name: Global Smartphone Market
description: Sector driving the majority of Apple’s revenue via iPhone demand.

name: Semiconductor & Chip Industry
description: Sector producing chips powering Apple devices.

name: Mobile App Economy & Services Sector
description: Industry encompassing mobile apps and services, critical to Apple’s revenue.

name: Personal Computing Industry
description: Global PC/laptop market affecting Apple’s Mac business.

name: Wearables & Consumer Electronics
description: Market for wearables and smart accessories, important for Apple growth.

name: Telecommunications Industry
description: Mobile network sector influences iPhone technologies and distribution.

name: Retail and E-commerce Industry
description: Sector affecting Apple’s product distribution and sales approach.

name: iPhone
description: Apple’s flagship smartphone; main revenue generator.

name: App Store
description: Platform for distributing iOS apps and key services revenue source.

name: Apple Services
description: Apple’s digital services division, including Music, TV+, iCloud, Pay, etc.

name: macOS
description: Operating system for Apple’s Mac computers.

name: Mac Hardware
description: Apple’s personal computing hardware products.

name: iPad
description: Apple’s tablet product line with significant education/business market.

name: Apple Watch
description: Leading smartwatch product in wearables segment.

name: AirPods
description: Popular wireless earbuds in Apple’s wearables segment.

name: ARM Architecture
description: Semiconductor ecosystem underlying Apple’s custom chips.

name: U.S. Department of Justice
description: American government regulator suing Apple for antitrust violations.

name: European Commission
description: Primary EU regulatory body enforcing antitrust and digital markets rules on Apple.

name: Chinese Government
description: China’s authorities affecting Apple’s access, supply, and compliance.

name: U.S.–China Trade Policy
description: Bilateral trade laws impacting Apple’s supply chain and costs.

name: U.S. Congress
description: American legislative body influencing Apple via bills, hearings, and policy pressure.

name: U.S. Judicial System
description: Courts influencing Apple’s policies via legal judgments (e.g. Epic v. Apple).

name: Federal Trade Commission
description: U.S. agency enforcing competition and consumer protection rules.

name: U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission
description: US regulator overseeing public company disclosures and finance.

name: Competition Commission of India
description: Indian regulator investigating Apple’s App Store practices.

name: Japan Fair Trade Commission
description: Japanese agency regulating fair competition; influenced App Store rule changes.

name: South Korean Regulator
description: Authorities requiring Apple to allow third-party app payments.

name: Tax Authorities (EU, US, etc.)
description: Institutions changing Apple’s tax practices and costs via rulings and law.

name: World Trade Organization
description: Global trade body affecting rules for tech companies like Apple.

name: China
description: Major market and global manufacturing hub for Apple; key to supply/demand.

name: United States
description: Apple’s home country; headquarters, top market, and innovation center.

name: European Union
description: Regulatory superpower and major consumer market for Apple.

name: Taiwan
description: Home of key Apple suppliers; critical to global chip supply.

name: India
description: Fast-growing market and rising manufacturing base for Apple.

name: Japan
description: Major iPhone market and source of high-tech components.

name: South Korea
description: Home of Samsung and LG, key rivals and suppliers.

name: Vietnam
description: Growing Apple manufacturing center, especially for accessories and iPads.

name: Singapore
description: Regional supply chain and component production hub for Apple.

name: Malaysia
description: Southeast Asian supply chain and manufacturing partner.

name: Thailand
description: Location for some Apple device assembly (e.g. MacBooks).

name: Latin America
description: Emerging region with growing iPhone adoption, local production to avoid tariffs.

name: Middle East
description: Emerging region, especially in UAE and Saudi Arabia, with affluent Apple customers.

name: Africa
description: Developing region, potential long-term growth market for Apple.

name: Tim Cook
description: Chief Executive Officer of Apple Inc. since 2011.

name: Jeff Williams
description: Chief Operating Officer of Apple; oversees supply chain and operations.

name: Craig Federighi
description: Senior VP, Software Engineering at Apple; oversees iOS and macOS software.

name: Johny Srouji
description: Senior VP, Hardware Technologies at Apple; leads chip development.

name: Phil Schiller
description: Former SVP Marketing, now Apple Fellow; oversees App Store and product launches.

name: Greg Joswiak
description: SVP of Worldwide Marketing at Apple; responsible for product marketing and launches.

name: Steve Jobs
description: Apple co-founder and former CEO; established Apple’s product vision and culture.

name: Margrethe Vestager
description: EU Competition Commissioner; leads antitrust action against Apple.

name: Lina Khan
description: Chair of U.S. Federal Trade Commission; leading Big Tech scrutiny.

name: Xi Jinping
description: President of China; shapes economic and tech policy affecting Apple.

name: Narendra Modi
description: Prime Minister of India; architect of manufacturing incentives attracting Apple.

name: Elon Musk
description: CEO of Tesla, SpaceX, Twitter; competitive influence in tech ecosystem.

name: Satya Nadella
description: CEO of Microsoft; shapes enterprise, cloud, and software competition with Apple.

name: Sundar Pichai
description: CEO of Google/Alphabet; leader of Apple’s key competitor in mobile and search.
